guide.introduction: Throwie-based modification of hoop earrings to illuminate them with LEDs.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Throwie-based modification of hoop earrings to illuminate them with LEDs.

Relevant parts
  • LED any size or type e.g. Mouser 604-WP7113QBC D
  • Hoop earring
  • Electrical Tape
  • Monofilament (Fishing) Line
  • CR2032 Lithium Battery
Tools
  • Jeweler's pliers
  • X-Acto knife

parts.text: LED any size or type e.g. Mouser 604-WP7113QBC D
parts.notes: T-1 is a good size.  Larger is too much.
If you want to get fancy, you can match the tape-color to the earring-color (e.g., red vinyl-coated hoops with red electrical tape).

lines.text: Note which lead is longer.  Using the jeweler's pliers, carefully bend both leads 180 degrees.  The idea is to illuminate the earring and the wearer, not the wearer's shoulder.
lines.text_raw: Note which lead is longer.  Using the jeweler's pliers, carefully bend both leads 180 degrees.  The idea is to illuminate the earring and the wearer, not the wearer's shoulder.

lines.text: Bend the longer lead 90 degrees to one side.
lines.text_raw: Bend the longer lead 90 degrees to one side.

lines.text: Bend the shorter lead into a circle.
lines.text_raw: Bend the shorter lead into a circle.

lines.text: Cut a generous length of monofilament (8-12").
lines.text_raw: Cut a generous length of monofilament (8-12").

lines.text: Tie the center of the monofilament around the hoop. Use a Round-Turn and 2 Half-Hitches.
lines.text_raw: Tie the center of the monofilament around the hoop.  Use a [http://www.animatedknots.com/roundturn/index.php?LogoImage=LogoGrog.jpg&Website=www.animatedknots.com|Round-Turn and 2 Half-Hitches].

lines.text: Make sure the knot is near the "top" of the earring.  The battery and LED will hang from the knot.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the knot is near the "top" of the earring.  The battery and LED will hang from the knot.

lines.text: Cut a length of electrical tape, sufficient to cover one side of the battery.
lines.text_raw: Cut a length of electrical tape, sufficient to cover one side of the battery.

lines.text: Cut one side of the monofilament at a length where the LED will hang below the hoop.
lines.text_raw: Cut ''one'' side of the monofilament at a length where the LED will hang below the hoop.

lines.text: Tape the cut monofilament and the longer (90° bend) LED lead to the positive face of the battery. Completely cover the battery's face.
lines.text_raw: Tape the cut monofilament and the ''longer'' (90° bend) LED lead to the ''positive'' face of the battery.  Completely cover the battery's face.

lines.text: If you want to get fancy, you can bend the lead in such a way that you can tie the monofilament to the lead.  Don't let the monofilament interfere with good contact between the battery and lead.
lines.text_raw: If you want to get fancy, you can bend the lead in such a way that you can tie the monofilament to the lead.  Don't let the monofilament interfere with good contact between the battery and lead.

lines.text: Trim the tape to the edge of the battery.
lines.text_raw: Trim the tape to the edge of the battery.

lines.text: Cut a length of electrical tape that will cover half of the other battery surface.
lines.text_raw: Cut a length of electrical tape that will cover half of the other battery surface.

lines.text: Position the LED such that a lead falls on each side of the hoop.  Tape the monofilament so the battery hangs evenly from both lengths.
lines.text_raw: Position the LED such that a lead falls on each side of the hoop.  Tape the monofilament so the battery hangs evenly from both lengths.

lines.text: Trim the monofilament to the edge of the tape.
lines.text_raw: Trim the monofilament to the edge of the tape.

lines.text: Trim the tape to the edge of the battery.
lines.text_raw: Trim the tape to the edge of the battery.

lines.text: Bend the short lead into good contact with the battery. Do not let the lead touch the edge of the battery -- that's part of the positive contact.
lines.text_raw: Bend the short lead into good contact with the battery.  Do ''not'' let the lead touch the edge of the battery -- that's part of the positive contact.
